TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ChangePasswordDesigner extends System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner

Docs.summary: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the Web server control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In a visual designer, when you switch from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword> control is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface. When you switch back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to the markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ChangePasswordDesigner> class when it creates the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword> control or a copy of that control on the design surface.

Docs.summary: Gets the action list collection for this designer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ActionLists property creates a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> object for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ChangePasswordDesigner> object, adds the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> object to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> object obtained from the base property, and then returns this collection.

Docs.summary: Specifies whether the control allows resizing.
Docs.value: if the control allows resizing; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of automatic format schemes that will be displayed in the **Auto Format** dialog box.
Docs.value: A that contains the predefined schemes for the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The elements of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatCollection> object are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormat> class and are populated from internally defined XML-encoded constant strings.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetDesignTimeHtml() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.String> containing the markup used to render the at design time.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The GetDesignTimeHtml method sets the mode of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword> control, which can be a copy, to the current mode of the actual control. Next, it forces the child controls to be recreated, and then calls the base method to generate the markup. If an error occurs, the GetDesignTimeHtml calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ChangePasswordDesigner.GetErrorDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to generate the markup for a placeholder.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetDesignTimeHtml(class System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection regions) cil managed

Docs.param: A to which a definition of the current view of the associated control has been added.
Docs.summary: Gets the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time and populates a collection of designer regions.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.String> containing the markup used to render the at design time.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The GetDesignTimeHtml method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ChangePasswordDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml> method to generate the markup for the design-time rendering of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword> control. It also adds a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion> object to the `regions` parameter that describes the current view of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword> control.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetEditableDesignerRegionContent(class System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion region) cil managed

Docs.param: An that is not used by this GetEditableDesignerRegionContent override.
Docs.summary: Gets the persisted form of the current template of the associated control.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.String> containing the persisted form of the current template of the associated .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The GetEditableDesignerRegionContent method serializes the current template (the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword.ChangePasswordTemplate%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword.SuccessTemplate%2A> property) of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword> control to its persisted form, which is a <xref:System.String> object of markup text. This persisted form consists of the serialized child controls appended together.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance string GetErrorDesignTimeHtml(class System.Exception e) cil managed

Docs.param: The <xref:System.Exception> that was thrown while creating or rendering the associated control.
Docs.summary: Gets the markup that renders to a placeholder containing information about the error that occurred while attempting to create or render the associated control at design time.
Docs.returns: The markup for the placeholder that contains information about the specified exception.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The placeholder contains the type and control names, an error message, and the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property that is associated with the `e` parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Initialize(class System.ComponentModel.IComponent component) cil managed

Docs.summary: Prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The designer host calls the Initialize method when it is ready to use the designer to render the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword> control. The Initialize method and its base methods configure properties and connect events that are necessary for the operation of the designer.
The `component` parameter is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword> control that is associated with this designer, or a copy of the control specified by `component`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void PreFilterProperties(class System.Collections.IDictionary properties) cil managed

Docs.param: A collection implementing the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> of the added and shadowed properties.
Docs.summary: Used by the designer to remove or add additional properties for display in the **Properties** grid or to shadow properties of the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Control designers use methods derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to shadow various control properties with corresponding design-time properties that the designer implements, and to add or remove properties from the **Properties** grid.
For the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword> control, the PreFilterProperties method sets the <xref:System.ComponentModel.BrowsableAttribute.Browsable%2A> attribute to `false` for properties that do not apply to templates (removes them from the **Properties** grid) when a user template has been defined.

Docs.summary: Specifies whether the control uses an outer table container to apply inline CSS style rules.
Docs.value: if the control uses an outer table container to apply inline CSS style rules; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ChangePasswordDesigner> control uses an outer table container to apply inline style rule in the markup. You can remove the outer table container by setting this property to true. Removing the outer table gives you greater flexibility in how you apply CSS rules to the markup that is rendered by the control.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void SetEditableDesignerRegionContent (System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion region, string content);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void SetEditableDesignerRegionContent(class System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion region, string content) cil managed

Docs.param: A <xref:System.String> containing a persisted control or template.
Docs.summary: Sets the value of a template of the associated control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The SetEditableDesignerRegionContent method sets an editable region in a designer to a control or template that is specified in its persisted form by the `content` parameter.

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of template groups for the templates of the control that is associated with this designer.
Docs.value: A containing an element for each template in the associated .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The TemplateGroups property constructs a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection> object and populates it with the collection returned by the base property. It then adds a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> object for each of the templates (<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword.ChangePasswordTemplate%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword.SuccessTemplate%2A>) of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword> control.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the designer should use a temporary copy rather than the actual control that is associated with the designer to generate the design-time markup.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Because the UsePreviewControl property is always `true`, the designer uses a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control that contains a temporary copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword> control to generate the design-time markup. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control does not affect any persistence for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword>. If the UsePreviewControl property were overridden to return `false`, the designer would use the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword> itself to generate the design-time markup.
